intro: Meibomia conzattii, commonly known as the Congo meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the canopy layer of the forest. Meibomia conzattii plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by providing nectar for various pollinators.
